Hoy (aqu√≠ todav√≠a es septiembre 10) es el d√≠a internacional de la prevenci√≥n del suicidio, septiembre es el mes amarillo tambi√©n por la prevenci√≥n del suicidio üïØüéó y, yo, me he unido con mi amiga @kareninbooks para dar visibilidad a este tema tan importante y a la salud mental, hemos estado subiendo historias y recomendaciones (deslizar para ver m√°s fotos), nos gustar√≠a que nos acompa√±aran y que sepan que cualquier cosa pueden contar conmigo üòâ.

"Happy moments go on forever. Even after they're over they still go on, those moments are lasting still, backward and forward, on into infinity. They are everything and everywhere all at once.
They are the meaning."
~Lauren Oliver "Before I Fall"

‚ú®‚ÄúSon estos pequenÃÉos detalles los que forman el dibujo de mi vida, como esos tapices tejidos a mano que son especiales precisamente por los pequenÃÉos defectos de la trama, por esos agujeritos, nudos e imperfecciones que los hacen irrepetibles‚Äù. ‚ú®Lauren Oliver nos cuenta la historia de Samantha Kingston, una estudiante popular del uÃÅltimo curso de instituto, que muere en un accidente de coche en una carretera un viernes por la noche tras una fiesta. Pero despierta al diÃÅa siguiente de nuevo en su cama, empezando el diÃÅa de ayer una vez maÃÅs. Con Sam nos damos cuenta de lo que significa la felicidad de cierta manera, no es sobre el sentido que le podriÃÅamos dar sino de demaÃÅs cosas que se unen, tambieÃÅn como el azar y las coincidencias  hacen que se muevan nuestras vidas. Durante las siete veces que vive su uÃÅltimo diÃÅa, Sam madura y cambia en pequenÃÉas cosas  y en otras maÃÅs grandes hasta comprender porque ha tenido la oportunidad de repetir ese diÃÅa una y otra vez.
Este libro nos invita a comprendernos a nosotros mismos y reflexionar sobre los temas que trata como la necesidad de encajar, el cambio, la esperanza  y los viÃÅnculos que nos unen. ¬øTuÃÅ queÃÅ hariÃÅas si despertaras una y otra vez en el mismo diÃÅa? Si no hubiera manÃÉana ¬øQue cambiarias? üåô‚ÄúIt is these little details that form the drawing of my life, like those hand-woven tapestries that are special precisely because of the small defects of the plot, because of those little holes, knots and imperfections that make them unrepeatable.‚Äù
Lauren Oliver tells us the story of Samantha Kingston, a popular senior high school student, who dies in a car accident on a road on a Friday night after a party. But he wakes up the next day again in his bed, starting yesterday once again. 
With Sam we realize what happiness means in a certain way, it's not about the meaning we could give it but about other things that come together, as well as chance and coincidences make our lives move. During the seven times he lives his last day, Sam matures and changes into small and larger things until he understands
 why he has had the opportunity to repeat that day over and over again.

Bonjour √† tous üôÉ
J'esp√®re que vous allez bien ? 
L'automne commence √† beaucoup se faire ressentir ü§ó, la saison d'halloween commence ü§©
C'est pour cela que je vous fais ce retour üòâ
(Oui je le range dans cette cat√©gorie lol)

Mon avis :
Une histoire touchante qui nous √©mu et nous fait r√©fl√©chir !
Et si √† la suite d'un accident vous revivez sans cesse votre derni√®re journ√©e ?
Que feriez-vous de mieux ? De pire ? Avec qui d√©cideriez-vous de passer ces derniers instants ? 
Ce sont ces questions auxquelles r√©pond l'h√©ro√Øne de notre histoire.
Ce roman est tr√®s bien √©crit, et on se rend compte que plus l'histoire passe et plus on rentre dans cette boucle, on en devient m√™me un personnage !
Revivre notre derni√®re journ√©e, √™tre dans cet entre-deux (entre la vie et la mort) c'est une nouveaut√© intrigante. On ne s'est pas encore questionn√© sur le sujet (du moins √ßa n'√©tait pas mon cas lol) c'est pour cela qu'on s'impr√®gne tr√®s vite de l'histoire, on commente les choix de Samantha, on se questionne, (aurions-nous fait la m√™me chose ?) on se compare √† si nous √©tions dans la m√™me situation, et on √©crit sans le vouloir notre boucle temporaire !
J'ai trouv√© ce proc√©d√© tr√®s int√©ressant, m√™me si je m'en suis rendu compte vers la fin üôÉ.
Tout √ßa pour vous conseiller de plonger dans ce roman, qui vous fera que du bien ‚ò∫Ô∏èüòâ.

Voici enfin mon avis apr√®s avoir lu ¬´¬†Before I Fall¬†¬ª de Laurent Olivier ü™∑

Tout d‚Äôabord, j‚Äôai appr√©ci√© la lecture qui √©tait plut√¥t facile du livre (pas de prise de t√™te sur la formulation des phrases etc).
On se replonge facilement dedans m√™me si une journ√©e est pass√© entre la pr√©c√©dente lecture et celle ci ce qui est plut√¥t g√©niale car on n‚Äôa pas l‚Äôimpression d‚Äô√™tre perdue au d√©but lorsqu‚Äôon reprend l‚Äôhistoire (ce que j‚Äôai horreur et qui m‚Äôarrive r√©guli√®rement car je n‚Äôai pas une tr√®s grande m√©moire ü§£)
L‚Äôhistoire est plut√¥t fascinante car il y a un peu de suspense qui nous tient mais un petit peu r√©p√©titif ce qui est normal d‚Äôun sens mais il ne fallait pas que ce soit plus long je pense ü§î 

Je lui donne tout de m√™me la note de 07/10 üòâ

Et vous les amours, vous l‚Äôavez lu? Qu‚Äôen avez vous penser ? üòå

I started reading Before I Fall years ago and forgot about it. When I started reading again I thought I‚Äôd finish it so I could watch the movie. 
Well I think I realized why I stopped reading. I didn‚Äôt really enjoy either the book or the movie. Samantha was just too whiny for me! I get that she tried to change by the end but she was too much.

Better late than never‚Ä¶

üí¨What is your zodiac sign? Do you find you can relate to it? 

Ok, so if I‚Äôm being totally honest, I don‚Äôt actually believe in zodiac signs or horoscopes. I just see them as a fun way to relate to others ‚ò∫Ô∏è plus, they can be entertaining to read about.

With that said, I do relate to the stereotypical Libra quality of trying to find & maintain balance in my life. In fact, I can be pretty indecisive when making big decisions because I weigh the pros and cons of everything! üòå‚öñÔ∏è

Before I Fall

üé∂: L‚Äôautre Valse D‚Äôam√©lie
Sc: @logolessdali
I remember really loving this book and then being super excited to watch the movie üòÜ I was so disappointed by the movie and it kinda ruined the book in my mind üò≠

Finished this a few days ago.
It was an interesting read and I liked how it was reminiscent of groundhog day but with a high schooler. Some parts really had me gritting my teeth at the popular-girl-stereotypes and there were some slurs used even though there was no trigger warning.
(Spoilers!)
The 5 stages of grief that were covered was interesting because she wasnt grieving for someone else, but herself. I did like how by the end, she was more considerate of others and was a better person. I also like how she didnt come back to life. Not because I didnt like her or anything, but because it's like real life. Not everything can be fixed, no one has an infinite amount of time, you just have to live while you can.
